qas.question: Who did Santa Anna order the reinstatement as comandante general?
What was the name of the federalist army officer who eventually came into power during the new election?
Who had actually won the original vote?
Who refused to yield until troops were summoned?

context: At a convention of citizens called to select a new provisional ruler, <a2_0>Gutierrez<a2_0/> obtained the vote, with <a3_0>P. J. Escalante<a3_0/> for his deputy, and a council to guide the administration. Santa Anna ordered the reinstatement of <a0_0>Mendarozqueta<a0_0/> as comandante general. Gutiérrez yielded, but Escalante refused to surrender office, demonstrations of support ensued, but <a4_0>Escalante<a4_0/> yielded when troops were summoned from Zacatecas. A new election brought a new legislature, and conforming governors. In September 1835 <a1_0>José Urrea<a1_0/> a federalist army officer came into power.
